details:
This security update fixes a number of security issues in
phpMyAdmin. We recommend you upgrade your phpmyadmin packages.


* [CVE-2016-1927](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-1927)
suggestPassword generates weak passphrases
* [CVE-2016-2038](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2038)
information disclosure via crafted requests
* [CVE-2016-2039](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2039)
weak CSRF token values
* [CVE-2016-2040](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2040)
XSS vulnerabilities in authenticated users
* [CVE-2016-2041](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2041)
information breach in CSRF token comparison
* [CVE-2016-2045](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2045)
XSS injection via crafted SQL queries
* [CVE-2016-2560](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2560)
XSS injection


Further information about Debian LTS security Advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>


For Debian 7 Wheezy, these issues have been fixed in phpmyadmin version 4:3.4.11.1-2+deb7u3
